subject: RE: [junit] StackOverflowException using XMLEncoder
msgSnippet: ... Hi Tom, JUnit has a history of LinkageError and ClassCastException problems with XML APIs (see the JUnit FAQ).  But I m not familiar with a
messageBody:
> From: S. T. Pimienta [mailto:stpimienta@...]
>
> Greetings, I am new to junit and this group. I wrote a test ( code
> follows ) using XMLEncoder ( hence JVM >= 1.4 ) that bombs w/
> StackOverflowException everytime. I ran the SAME code in my
> classes'main method, w/o junit, and it works fine. I Googled
> this but couldn't come up w/ anything. Should I just not to be
> able to write objects out as .xml files w/ junit? What did I goof
> up?

Hi Tom,

JUnit has a history of LinkageError and ClassCastException problems with XML APIs (see the JUnit FAQ). But I'm not familiar with a StackOverflowException being a problem. Your code looks fine, so it must be an interaction between JUnit and the JVM and/or its XML libs that causes it. Can you post the stack trace from the StackOverflowException?

Thanks,
Scott Stirling
Workscape, Inc.
